channel.title: The Great Gatsby
channel.description:
Has anyone seen the movie or read the book? I've read the book is pretty good, but I've heard the movie is just a flashy Hollywood repeat.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Great_Gatsby

item.title: The Great Gatsby
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

My teacher is an enthusiast when it comes to the book, and she said the movie was amazing, so I’d assume the movie is actually pretty good. I can’t necessarily say for myself, but I think I’ll go and see it this week. The critics did rate the movie pretty harshly, but critics are usually are bad judges when you compare them towards the general population watching the movie.

Loveandpower:

movies never give the book due credit. Haven’t seen the movie but I have read the book a few years back in like middle/high school

From what my teacher said, the movie did a great job of portraying most of the events that happened in the book.

Read full topic

item.title: The Great Gatsby
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Has anyone seen the movie or read the book? I’ve read the book is pretty good, but I’ve heard the movie is just a flashy Hollywood repeat.

en.wikipedia.org

The Great Gatsby

The Great Gatsby is a 1925 novel written by American author F. Scott Fitzgerald that follows a cast of characters living in the fictional town of West and East Egg on prosperous Long Island in the summer of 1922. The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan. Considered to be Fitzgerald's magnum opus, The Great Gatsby explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change,...

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TaBVLhcHcc0[/youtube]

Read full topic
